data.text:
@dougwears There should be a little star thing at the top of your feed, set it to make sure it’s set to people you follow/latest tweets 
It’s probably because you’re interacting with those tweets (negatively from what I’ve see) and the algorithm isn’t advance enough to detect that
@leakiestfaucet Except Microsoft cause I want activsion games on the thing I’m already paying for anyway
@jessekellestine Well duh that was to balance the books now he needs not balance the books money
@ohshlebs @CarleyColesy This was in 2003 as well so like NOT EVEN LIKE A I CANT REMEMBER LIFE AT THIS TIME I FULLY EXISTED AND HAVE MEMORIES OF THIS TIME

@ohshlebs @CarleyColesy My mom bought her current place on like a 60k salary earlier this year a house in the area sold for 884k 
It was a TOWN HOME
@tinypeytz It’s literally like 4 separate malls it’s insane

@CaligulaIII In a perfect world you are absolutely correct there should be no exclusives I should be able to play whatever where ever but that’s not reality.we have one sub service that grants day one access to first party games and one that doesn’t which makes one more consumer friendly

@CaligulaIII multiple times a year being on a sub service that costs $10-$20 bucks that can be turned on and off when you want and then entry cost in the context of gaming is low is consumer friendly in the context of gaming

@CaligulaIII I’m getting the sense that we are using the term consumer friendly differently which is causing confusion, I think we are both aware that as whole gaming isn’t consumer friendly it’s fucking expensive. When I say this is consumer friendly I’m saying these $70 games that come out
@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Exclusives are inherently bad, but making them available at a reduced price point is better than what we have had previously in my opinion

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I feel like my tweet indicates that they are not. But making an exclusive available on a $10-$20 sub service which is available on multiple platforms at a starting price point of $270 is better than Sonys business model of $70 on $500-$700 console

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Trust me man I woulda loved to not have to buy a ps5 but gaming is a passion and unfortunately it’s also a luxury. But GP business model hinges on being available on as many platforms as it can which is good for gamers as it’s accessible is my point

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx So you’re misunderstanding what I’m saying, I am aware they don’t care. I am saying is the way their business model is making GP better which is GOOD for gamers. They don’t care about us but their business model depends on being a better product and accessibility

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I don’t care who makes money that’s not my concern. The main things I want is more games on GP and Sony to have actual competition and be in a position to put in a better effort so that makes me in favour of the deal it’s not coming from a place of I want MS to have more money

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx platform Sony said no (obviously as it would make MS money) MS subscription service is simply more accessible and is better than Sonys. A 10-20 dollar monthly fee is better for the general consumer than paying $70 multiple times a year

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx … slowly? My internet is pretty ass downloads take some time is what it is. But yes I can explain that, MS puts all of their FP games on their service Sony does not, GP is available on Xbox (one,series s/x) PC and steam deck. MS has offered to allow GP to appear on a Sony-

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Brother I live in Canada games have been 89.99 the second the ps5 game out so that point of contention falls on deaf ears for me, but regardless if cloud progresses far enough the goal would likely be to circumvent that or possibly make it available to download

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Again I’ve already stated I don’t care about either company so I’m not sure where that idea is coming from. I have game pass on Pc and I have my ps5 this deal goes through game pass gets better and likely forces Sony to make theirs better I’ve now got 2 better products

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx A 70 dollar price tag is irrelevant when their subscription makes the game available day one which can be toggled on an off monthly to be flexible. Ownership of games is a different discussion but as a whole the general public finishes a game and typically won’t return

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I think you’re missing what I’m saying because I didn’t say they cared about gamers I agreed that they care about making money BUT their business model is very clearly based on having the most gamers and being accessible to do that you need to do what is best for them

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I’m not saying they want to stop cloud gaming I’m saying they don’t want another company to progress faster than them (which is fair) but they are misleading most people in that. Their streaming is a fucking joke and they don’t want people to have a better option currently

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Sony has mislead the general public to think  it’s because of COD to sway public perception. Sony doesnt want a competitive environment because that means changing their formula They do not want to put an emphasis on progressing cloud gaming they want us to accept the trash given

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx That’s the thing right there they care about making money the way to do that is by progressing gaming and doing what’s best for gamers and Microsoft recognises this hence their desire to progress cloud gaming and making their game pass more attractive

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Picking a side of Sony or Microsoft and being a fanboy in the year 2022 is absurd. Gamers should want accessibility and choice, this merger would accelerate cloud gaming making more games available in more ways. Sony very clearly doesn’t want this and is using COD as a scapegoat

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Exactly though so people’s wants should align with what’s best for consumers as a whole, I don’t generally care about company wants and their finances I care about what’s best for gamers, and games being available without purchase and actual competition is a win imo

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Having more games on an affordable subscription service is good. Forcing Sony to not be as complacent they’ve been and start invest in games that aren’t remakes or sequels. More IPs more infrastructure to get ahead in cloud and other mediums is a positive for consumers

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx So you think shareholders are okay with not getting an instant boost to the tune of 10 billion while also getting continuous profits?
I don’t really have a horse in this race as I have a PS5 and use game pass on my PC, I just think ultimately this is good for consumers -
@domluszczyszyn Always had faith in you
@PisanoRomano @LeafsGuyCarlo This also isn’t even a “I don’t like parayko” prior to his back injury I was really big on the leafs swinging for him and tank 🤷🏻‍♀️ https://t.co/IbxNzr5LGm
@Mcassin11Mike @wyshynski @domluszczyszyn If they lose in round one and the goaltending is anywhere close to this level you’re looking at your forwards not scoring enough for a 4th year in a row

@LeafsGuyCarlo @PisanoRomano He’s missed 3 this year, and 21 the year you are referring to that one being a massive concern as it was considered to possibly be career threatening. You don’t move emerging young D or a guy on pace to score 40 for a guy who has a history like that.

@DanielJones9417 @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski I don’t know much about goalies so I tend to differ to people that do, Kevin Woodley is a great example of someone who can explain the finer and more nuanced aspects of not just goalies but players as well

@domluszczyszyn I think one thing with Murray that couldn’t really be accounted for, dude just has ice in his veins and is very clearly playing with purpose. I also didn’t expect the defence to be for lack of a better term defending out of their fucking minds especially with the injuries

@domluszczyszyn @wyshynski Coupled with some rumours about a lot of conflict between him and Ovi felt a change of scenery would serve him well, as for Murray he’s been adjusting his game to how todays NHL is played since he left the pens. The sens didn’t have the patience for it Leafs are just benefiting

@domluszczyszyn @wyshynski I would be very lying if I said I was expecting the both of them to have .933 save % this far into the season 😅 but I did expect both to have at least could seasons in .910-.917 range. The caps had/have a pathetic defence group so I thought that would help samsonov-

@domluszczyszyn @wyshynski Son of a bitch… you’re back in the parade 🫡

Seriously though the PDOcast has had Kevin Woodley to talk goalies a few times (once in July and again in November) and it’s really insightful and July dove deep into Murray and is super insightful, Nov ep is more broad
@PisanoRomano @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski Don’t forget my podcast where you can hear me mock people for telling me I was wrong 😎
@PisanoRomano @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski Hockey is random until it’s not duh

@PisanoRomano @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski Media members be like “we were wrong but there’s no possible anyone thought this was a possibility right???”
Like I’m not one to differ to authority but sometimes you have to consider “maybe the smart glasses guy who has stats that aren’t publicly available knows what he’s doing”
Media members eating absolute crow today by saying no one believed in a murray samsonov tandem LMAO mfs showing up with RECEIPTS

@domluszczyszyn @wyshynski Speak for yourself pls just because media members chalk up goaltending as “voodoo”doesn’t mean others do. Matt Murray spent a lot of time adjusting his game after being on the pens to match the style of todays game. The leafs are benefiting from him finally adapting to the change https://t.co/1lu1D1n4sM

@PisanoRomano @LeafsGuyCarlo Parayko also has a history of back injuries, the dude is an injury away from being like muzzin if you’re going to propose the leafs make a move for a player (by moving 2 of their best D currently or top goal scorer) you should do more research beyond “player big shoots right”

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx An interesting thinking point though is out ACTI shareholders will feel towards Sony win or lose considering the deal is worth 10 billion more than the market value of the company

urls.title: Microsoft Has Made a '10-Year Commitment' to Bring Call of Duty to Nintendo Consoles - IGN
urls.description: Xbox boss Phil Spencer has said that Microsoft has entered a "10-year commitment" to bring Call of Duty to Nintendo consoles following its acquisition of Activision Blizzard.

urls.title: Microsoft Accuses Sony of Paying to Block Games from Xbox Game Pass

data.text: @Darkborn162 @Danumis_ @KoKane_96 @lulumeservey https://t.co/hq4pUH58HJ we literally know that sony has paid to developers to not put games on game pass. Sony doesn’t want this to go through because it would force them to be better and they’re perfectly fine with how things are going for them, remakes remasters and sequels

@yosonimbord @Sloaneyjr @lalonludi @Real_Moto_Moto @TronKane @lulumeservey Shareholders of a company that’s valued at 59 billion dollars won’t be upset that a another company played a major roll in blocking the sale that would’ve given $10 billion more than their market value? Are you sure?

Ultimately i think Microsoft has a rather strong case and can sway any unbiased court in their favour, the major points of contention are (in my opinion) rather easy to justify. Ie, exclusivity of Activision titles, the strength of game pass, and the advantage in cloud gaming

Incredibly curious if this is successful and the deal doesn’t close if Microsoft pivots and uses the what 70 billion dollars they’d have free to just buy out Japanese companies that historically Sony had certain exclusivity agreements with https://t.co/qYMxxde6Uv

@Rutlandx93 Take what I said with a grain of salt! They’re a big company so they *should* have a deal but since this stuff isn’t really where they make their money I also wouldn’t be surprised if they didn’t
@Knycrotic https://t.co/lg1oCC8kPL

tweets.text: So, Elon took over Twitter and now my feed has slowly been infected with right wing propaganda from accounts I do not follow. Not interested sticking around if this gets worse. Also inB4 “echo chamber” Im on Twitter for my friends and memes 🥴
https://t.co/vozqvBXth9
Doug Ford asking for more healthcare funding after continually cutting healthcare funding is prison shit. https://t.co/MS8abebQUM
@Strife_jpg @CarleyColesy Bro what the fuck
@CarleyColesy STOP I hate it here 😭
Yorkdale mall is too fucking big man I was there for 2 hours and now I need to sleep for 2 business days

@CaligulaIII multiple times a year being on a sub service that costs $10-$20 bucks that can be turned on and off when you want and then entry cost in the context of gaming is low is consumer friendly in the context of gaming

@CaligulaIII I’m getting the sense that we are using the term consumer friendly differently which is causing confusion, I think we are both aware that as whole gaming isn’t consumer friendly it’s fucking expensive. When I say this is consumer friendly I’m saying these $70 games that come out

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx You said it yourself, gaming is a luxury.  Luxuries aren’t consumer friendly.  This is capitalism at its finest.  MS is behind so they buy Activison and make multi-platform games exclusive.  Sony does the same shit.  It’s all gross

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I feel like my tweet indicates that they are not. But making an exclusive available on a $10-$20 sub service which is available on multiple platforms at a starting price point of $270 is better than Sonys business model of $70 on $500-$700 console
@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Are exclusives consumer friendly?

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx They care though, that’s my point.  And again, the deal going forward no matter how you spin, isn’t consumer friendly.  If someone has only a PS5, which costs a ton, then wants to play Starfield, they have to shell out a ton more money now.  Exclusives for either aren’t friendly

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I’m not disagreeing with that.  I’m disagreeing with you saying it’s because MS cares about gamers.  They didn’t come up with Game Pass because they care.  It’s about money.  They literally don’t give a shit about us beyond our wallets.  Neither does Sony.

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx platform Sony said no (obviously as it would make MS money) MS subscription service is simply more accessible and is better than Sonys. A 10-20 dollar monthly fee is better for the general consumer than paying $70 multiple times a year

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx … slowly? My internet is pretty ass downloads take some time is what it is. But yes I can explain that, MS puts all of their FP games on their service Sony does not, GP is available on Xbox (one,series s/x) PC and steam deck. MS has offered to allow GP to appear on a Sony-

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Can you now explain how MS scooping up a publisher who has published massive amounts of games to Sony consoles is consumer friendly?  The same could go for Sony if they bought a company like Square Enix.  I’d either company wants exclusives, it means they don’t care about us
@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx So a $70 price tag is good for consumers who live in area’s with poor internet and can’t cloud game?
@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx And if roles were reversed, MS would do the exact thing Sony is doing.  Stop defending a billion dollar company that doesn’t care about you at all

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx I think you’re missing what I’m saying because I didn’t say they cared about gamers I agreed that they care about making money BUT their business model is very clearly based on having the most gamers and being accessible to do that you need to do what is best for them

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Lol, no they don’t.  They do what’s best for themselves and their company.  If they cared so much about gamers they wouldn’t have raised prices to $70 just like Sony did.  They push stuff forward to try and make money, not because they care about gamers.

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx They are literally doing the same thing to each other.  Trying to take something away from someone else, to make themselves more money.  The idea that Sony is trying to stop cloud gaming moving forward as something they don’t want is laughable

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx That’s the thing right there they care about making money the way to do that is by progressing gaming and doing what’s best for gamers and Microsoft recognises this hence their desire to progress cloud gaming and making their game pass more attractive

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx But MS and Sony both don’t care what’s good for gamers.  They care about money and making more of it.  GamePass only exists because the last Xbox generation didn’t do well.  It was to help them generate more money.

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Exactly though so people’s wants should align with what’s best for consumers as a whole, I don’t generally care about company wants and their finances I care about what’s best for gamers, and games being available without purchase and actual competition is a win imo

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Again though, the defense of billionaires and their companies by working class people just because they make a good game is insane.  Both Sony and MS just want peoples money and to make their board and investors more money.  That’s it.  They don’t care about gamers beyond wallets

@CaligulaIII @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx So you think shareholders are okay with not getting an instant boost to the tune of 10 billion while also getting continuous profits?
I don’t really have a horse in this race as I have a PS5 and use game pass on my PC, I just think ultimately this is good for consumers -

@Strife_jpg @rik1981007 @SmallsTayvia @moatxsx Shareholders usually just care about continuous profit.  If Sony helps provide that, they won’t care.  These business’ just want to generate money and the idea they actually care about ‘gamers’ beyond their wallet, is foolish
@Strife_jpg wait nevermind i’m a genius after all 😂 https://t.co/vdeHqmJHs3
@Strife_jpg @LeafsGuyCarlo especially cause if you did the deal and parayko sustained an injury the Takes would turn into how dubas traded for a bandaid
@Strife_jpg @wyshynski @domluszczyszyn Still, Murray/Samsonov can post 30 shutouts between now and the end of the season but if they get blown up in the 1st round, it will be looked on as a failure.
@Strife_jpg @PisanoRomano I've literally wanted Parayako on this team for like 7 years and he literally plays most of the season every year except 2 years ago. I guess narratives though

@Strife_jpg @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski I know nothing about goaltending but I certainly thought this COULD happen. Murray has been very good, then he's had some bad stretches as goalies are known to do, dealt with some very difficult things and played for the Ottawa Senators. There's no reason he couldn't rebound
@Strife_jpg @wyshynski i had murray at .911 and samsonov at .908 in my fantasy projections — mostly because of the change in environment to leafs defence

@domluszczyszyn @wyshynski I would be very lying if I said I was expecting the both of them to have .933 save % this far into the season 😅 but I did expect both to have at least could seasons in .910-.917 range. The caps had/have a pathetic defence group so I thought that would help samsonov-

@Strife_jpg @wyshynski i was cautiously optimistic, but thought they would be Fine — and that it wouldn’t sewer the team. team defense was very underrated which goes with your first samsonov point. this good is certainly a but of a surprise but kudos to you for seeing it
@Strife_jpg @wyshynski *very few very smart people* 🫣😊
@Strife_jpg @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski hockey is random until my take/metric is correct anyways please subscribe to my patreon/substack 😎

@Strife_jpg @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski this is the mantra of every sports media person: if i’m right it’s cause i’m smart and perfect and if i’m wrong it’s cause Hockey Random™️

https://t.co/FCHBaFwIWr
@Strife_jpg @domluszczyszyn @wyshynski you didn’t have to take bro to the cleaners like that sheesh 😭
@wyshynski revisionist history about goalies should be illegal. *no one* thought they would be great or even good. they are. it’s fun! that’s all it has to be!

@LeafsGuyCarlo Parayko just signed a 8 year x 6.5M deal with a full no trade clause until he’s 37 years old. the leafs have allowed the 4th fewest goals in the league despite injuries to key defensemen. if you’re going to pay out the ass to add a player it shouldn’t be Parayko.

urls.title: Microsoft Has Made a '10-Year Commitment' to Bring Call of Duty to Nintendo Consoles - IGN
urls.description: Xbox boss Phil Spencer has said that Microsoft has entered a "10-year commitment" to bring Call of Duty to Nintendo consoles following its acquisition of Activision Blizzard.

urls.title: FTC sues to block Microsoft’s acquisition of game giant Activision
